title: Fran Escribá
text:
Francisco 'Fran' Escribá Segura (born 3 May 1965) is a Spanish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and former player who played as a <a href="Midfielder%23Winger">left winger</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Valencia">Valencia</a>, Escribá played youth football with <a href="Valencia%20CF">Valencia CF</a>, but never competed in higher than <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20B">Segunda División B</a> as a senior; he represented <a href="Valencia%20CF%20Mestalla">CD Mestalla</a>, <a href="CF%20Nules">CF Nules</a>, <a href="FC%20Andorra">FC Andorra</a>, <a href="Catarroja%20CF">Catarroja CF</a>, <a href="Torrent%20CF">Torrent CF</a>, <a href="CD%20Eldense">CD Eldense</a>, <a href="Novelda%20CF">Novelda CF</a>, CD Villena and Pinoso CF. In 2002, after a year in charge of <a href="CD%20Bu%C3%B1ol">CD Buñol</a>, he returned to Valencia, taking care of the youth sides.
In 2004, Escribá started an association with <a href="Quique%20S%C3%A1nchez%20Flores">Quique Sánchez Flores</a> that would last several seasons, always as assistant. He started with <a href="Getafe%20CF">Getafe CF</a>, subsequently moving to <a href="S.L.%20Benfica">S.L. Benfica</a> and <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a>; the pair went their separate ways at the end of <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20La%20Liga">2010–11</a>, because the former wanted to have a go at head coaching. 
Escribá was appointed at <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a> club <a href="Elche%20CF">Elche CF</a> on 12 June 2012. In <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">his first year</a> he led the <a href="Valencian%20Community">Valencians</a> to <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> after an absence of 24 years and, on 28 May 2013, renewed his contract for two more seasons.
On 26 June 2015, following <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20La%20Liga">Elche's administrative relegation</a>, Escribá was named <a href="Getafe%20CF">Getafe CF</a> manager. On 11 April of the following year, with the team seriously threatened with relegation, he was sacked.
On 11 August 2016, Escribá replaced <a href="Marcelino%20Garc%C3%ADa%20Toral">Marcelino García Toral</a> at the helm of <a href="Villarreal%20CF">Villarreal CF</a>. He led the side to the fifth position in <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20La%20Liga">his first season</a>, with the subsequent <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20UEFA%20Europa%20League">qualification</a> to the <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a>.
On 25 September 2017, in spite of many injuries to the squad, and following a 4–0 away loss against former club Getafe, Escribá was fired. He returned to work on 3 March 2019, becoming <a href="RC%20Celta%20de%20Vigo">RC Celta de Vigo</a>'s third coach of <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20La%20Liga">the campaign</a> after <a href="Miguel%20Cardoso%20%28football%20manager%29">Miguel Cardoso</a>'s dismissal. 
Escribá was relieved of his duties on 3 November 2019, with the team sitting in the relegation zone. He returned to Elche in February 2021, avoiding relegation in <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20La%20Liga">the last matchday</a> at the expense of <a href="SD%20Huesca">SD Huesca</a> after a 2–0 home win over <a href="Athletic%20Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a>.
On 21 November 2021, following a 0–3 home loss to <a href="Real%20Betis">Real Betis</a> which saw the side move into the relegation zone, Escribá was dismissed.
